fields.description:
I'm finally able to report a bug. I could not earlier as it keeps saying I was not logged in after getting a 500 just after login.\\
I still get a 500 page after login, I cannot see my dashboard.

This is the public bug I had reported earlier: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/6292/getting-500-error-after-logging-in

We recently transferred a repository to a team account. I then forked that repository, did some work on my fork and created a pull request. Once the pull request is created, I get redirected to the pull requests page on the original repository and am presented with the error: "Something has gone horribly wrong"

I have read access in both directions, and if I am logged in as the user account under which the team was created, I can view the diff and accept the pull request. I just cannot view the pull request on the original repository if I am logged in with my own account, as a team member.

This only seems to be happening with teams...
fields.summary: Teammates cannot view diffs on pull requests

fields.description:
Looking at the code in a repo, I can't tell when a commit was made.

Use-case: We have contractors working on our code and when matching invoices for code done,  we check the date of the work and the commits which were made.

The relative dates makes this difficult, and it's not possible to do in any good way (I was told I can hover over the relative date to get the actual date, but I think it should be possible to toggle instead).

For now, I end up using the console tool 'tig' to do this instead. It has the ability to do both relative and actual date.
fields.summary: a way to see the exact dates in place of the relative ones (BB-7428)

fields.description: I looking for a default sorting of issues by version for example. Or if I could configure it in administration of separate repo, that would be great.
Github has this feature, it's very usefull. I appreciate it. Thx.

I have committed a code around 10 days ago in a repository. In "Commit History" page it is showing me correct history but in "Recent Activity" page, it showing me same commits as "6 hours ago". This is a blunder and not expected in software like BitBucket.
fields.summary: Wrong date/time is shown in Recent Activity of a repository.
500 error when creating an invalid repository link (BB-7519)

fields.description:
When I make changes I put considerable effort into explaining what I'm doing in the commit logs. When I create a pull request for multiple commits, none of this is visible, either to me or to reviewers. On the commits tab they can see the subjects of each commit, but they need to click on all of them to view the detail.

Please can the full commit logs be visible on the commits tab (possibly with an expand/contract button to make this optional)?

With the current arrangement, my reviewers often don't realise that my explanatory text exists; sometimes I end up writing the description again in the pull request description (which is bad because it isn't tracked in the repo).
fields.summary: View full commit logs in pull request (BB-7422)
Emoji in commit messages break layout

fields.description:
HI,\\
I encountered the view issues with bitbucket on IE 8 and chrome browsers while using.\\
Please have a look on these issues.\\
For the reference I am sending the screens of the same attached with this.
fields.summary: Site not working in IE 8 and Chrome

fields.description: In projects with lots of tags, the list can become overwhelming. There should be some way to reduce the size of the list either by groups or some other method.
fields.summary: Add a way or method to group tags and branches (BB-7421)

fields.description: When I am removing messages from my inbox, I select the check box to select all messages and then I hit delete, it results in a terrifying 404! I would except to be redirected to my now empty inbox.
fields.summary: Deleting all messages in inbox redirect to 404

fields.description:
Instead of having a global "Email Notifications" option, it would be great to only receive notifications for specific repositories and/or actions (pull request created, pull request updated, comment on pull request, comment on commit, added to repo, permissions changed on repo, etc.).

Primarily, it'd be great to be able to subscribe/unsubscribe from specific repositories.

Hi,

Why we have a email_mailinglist as a field in the repository entrypoint, But no field in the website to set this value?

Is there a way to do this through the web interface, instead of doing only on the API?

I installed the newest Umbraco version, then installed uBlogsy. I created a generic home page template, allowed it to have "Blog Landing" children and then moved the blog node underneath it.

After doing this, the "Content" node fails to load. I traced it to the CreatePost.ascx file. There is an if statement for:

foreach (var root in roots)\\
{\\
if (root.ContentType.Alias == "uBlogsyLanding")\\
{\\
ddlRoots.Items.Add(new ListItem(root.Text, root.Id.ToString()));\\
}\\
else\\
{\\
....\\
** ddlRoots.Items.Add(new ListItem(landing.Text, landing.Id.ToString()));**\\
}

The bold line is what faile. The "landing" object does NOT have a "Text" property. If I comment that line out, the list still builds fine for me, but I'm not sure what scenario this line is needed.

I checked something in and the global git user name on my local machine was used (not a valid bitbucket user) and so I setup the appropriate user alias and this fixed the issue in the Commits pane of the repository but the Overview pane's "Recent activity" stream still shows the unrecognized user name (and I'd like it to not be visible).

the repo in question is here:  https://bitbucket.org/GeekAndDad/uiimage-stencil-experiment/overview  and you can see that "Tyler" made a commit after "thedad" created the repo.  In the Commits pane you can see that the Tyler's have all been mapped to "thedad" properly.

thanks.
fields.summary: user aliases change user on Commits pane but not in Recent activity in Overview

fields.description:
I am using the issue tracker to help facilitate communication with my client. It works great but as a non-techy type I have had to handhold him quite a bit.

There is probably quite a large subset of Bitbucket users who are "non-coders" - that is, they require access to issue trackers/wikis but don't really care about the code side of things, and don't have any idea what a repository is, etc.

What would be really nice is if those users could be given a streamlined user interface that brings issues/wikis to the fore, and puts the repo itself in the back seat (though probably a good idea to retain access if they want to take a look).

Also, I think the issue tracker documentation would benefit from a simple page explaining how to actually use the tracker - at the moment it's focused on adding milestones/components etc and assumes some prior knowledge of how an issue tracker works. Sure, it's not difficult but a page in the docs would save X number of devs explaining it to Y number of non-coders.

Thinking about it, even just a "Bitbucket for non-technical users" guide would be a great help - it could be a subset of the current docs and just walk people through what the different terms mean, what they will be interested in and what they don't need to worry about.

I know that non-coders are not exactly Bitbucket's target market, but making it easier for them would be very useful to people like myself and I'm sure many others.

From wiki UI, it's not possible to see my wiki pages, only de Home page is accessible.

I can see it by putting the URL on the broswer, e.g:

https://bitbucket.org/.../...l/wiki/wikipagename
fields.summary: I can not access my wikis

fields.description: For those of us considering a merge from a private hosted issue tracker ( Redmine ), it would be great if there was an option in the Issue tracker setup, to set the starting issue number, especially when used along with the "commit closes issue" service.

fields.summary: can't hg push my changes - account created with github

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/miloslevacic/bitbucket-bug-markdown-toc

Here's a public repo with just a README.md that demonstrates the problem.

The top margins for the nested {{<ul>}} elements are way off, so the auto-generated [TOC] listing looks weird.

I haven't tested it, but I assume the same bug would be present when just creating nested lists manually (I wanted to reproduce the bug here in the issue report, but it doesn't show up due to a different stylesheet).
fields.summary: Fix nested list margins in auto-generated [TOC]
seems the post commit hook fails again? (BB-7509)

fields.description: I'm trying to use tables in markdown per Gruber's syntax and the table html is literally rendering instead showing tables. Are there additional requirements to using table html in the bitbucket version of markdown?

I've transfered a repository between my user and a new team I've created but there is no way to accept the transfer. The transfer is complete but it still shows the message. Also the time for when it was transfered is not updating.
Can issues be imported from GitHub?
This page is shown for 2 days

Steps to reproduce:

# Send a message to a user
# Have the user reply to the message
# Delete the thread
# Have the user reply again.
# You can no longer delete the thread.
fields.summary: Can't delete replies if original message has already been deleted (BB-7518)

fields.description:
Rendered MarkDown assigns titles/headers in the document an ID when generating the HTML. But the ID in some cases is just the original title verbatim, so this allows a title to accidentally get assigned an ID that is already in use elsewhere on the page.

In my repository I have a README: https://bitbucket.org/B_Con/project-euler (note: it's private). I have a section titled "content" in the README which gets the ID "content" when it's rendered, but the page already has a CSS rule for the ID "content". So my README's "content" DIV gets the wrong rule applied to it and a bad rendering happens.

A simple fix might be to prefix all the rendered IDs with some constant not used anywhere else, like "document-section-*" or something.

It would be nice to be able to control email/email diff notices at the user level instead of at the project level.

ex:

UserA has write (non-admin) access to ProjectA, ProjectB, and ProjectC.\\
UserA wants to get Email Diff notices for ProjectA and ProjectC, but not ProjectB without involving the various project admins to add UserA's email address to the Email Diff hook.

2/5/13 9:25:30.585 AM com.apple.launchd.peruser.501[142]: ([0x0-0x22b22b].org.pythonmac.unspecified.wxterminal[4581]) Exited with code: 255

I downloaded py2app today and am running python 2.7. The application uses several libraries, wx, pyserial, pyproj....
fields.summary: Application built with Py2App fails with unspecified error

fields.description: I think having the branches displayed where the commits are made would useful.  See the attached image for an example.

Is there a way currently to integrate the repository with YouTrack by JetBrains?\\
We are exploring the idea of using YouTrack for our issue tracking system and would like to connect it to our repository.

Aparently, whily truing out bitbucket and github integration, two import jobs I created got somehow stucked... They are: https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/103084 and https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/103090. The repositories created by these two jobs can be deleted as I managed to repeat the imports later without problems.

It would be great if the POST service was expanded to include merged pull requests as well as pushes to the repo. The idea behind this being that a POST request is issued alerting the remote server/user/whatever that a change has been made to the repository.

For example, when I have a "development" branch that I merge into the "master" branch I would like to get a POST request that alerts me to a modification of my repo so I can take the appropriate actions. Currently I am only alerted when code is pushed to the repo. If I'm working in a development branch I would never push that same code to the master branch, I would simple merge the development branch into the master via a pull request.

Just a little enhancement that would go a long way.

Thanks guys, keep up the great work!
fields.summary: Expand POST Service to include other hooks/events (BB-7400)

The repository import screen message isn't updated to something useful when a repo import has failed. This should be changed so that instead of continuing to tell the user "We're getting things warm and cozy for your code.", it should say something like "Your import has failed, please try again."
fields.summary: Make a better error screen when a repo import has failed (BB-7381)

fields.description:
Hi,

We are a small team (3 persons) but we use Bitbucket every day (39 repositories), and JIRA (1x 25 licence) and Confluence, thanks for you amazing job!

But we have a huge problem on almost every repository.\\
After few weeks, we cannot pull the latest commits.

Error:

{code}
#!shell

From https://user@bitbucket.org/repo_user/repo.git
 * branch            master     -> FETCH_HEAD
There are no candidates for merging among the refs that you just fetched.
Generally this means that you provided a wildcard refspec which had no
matches on the remote end.

{code}

Our config file is:

{code}
#!shell

[core]
	repositoryformatversion = 0
	filemode = true
	bare = false
	logallrefupdates = true
[remote "origin"]
	url = git@bitbucket.org:repo_user/repo.git
	fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*
[remote "original"]
	url = https://user@bitbucket.org/repo_user/repo.git
	fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/original/*
[branch "master"]
	remote = origin
	merge = refs/heads/master
[user]
	name = Prod
	email = email@website.com

{code}

Our solution? Create an another repository (ex: "repo2") and push an init commit from complete source "repo". It's very dirty, I know.

So, can you help us? This problem occurs only on Bitbucket repository and we don't want to change.

Of course, we tried:

* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5131105/pull-all-unfetched-changes-from-git-repository
* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13799108/git-wildcard-refspec-with-no-match-on-remote-when-pulling

Thanks.

Currently numeric lists start with 1 whatever the actual numbers you write. Python-Markdown supports setting the starting index to the first number, but apparently it needs to be [explicitly enabled|http://gitorious.org/python-markdown/mainline/merge_requests/13]. It would be nice if you did this.
fields.summary: Support custom starting indices in numeric lists in Markdown (disable lazy_ol) (BB-7383)

The repository (https://bitbucket.org/nali/cs380-2013) is still listed as a fork of the original however.

fields.description:

Right now, it is unclear whether there is any attachment added to the issue. At least a note in the message which specifies that there even is an attachment would be an inbetween step, perhaps.

fields.description: I would like to be able to attach files to comments on pull requests and issues. This are usually either log file snippets, or stack traces. Right now, I inline them in code snippets, but this is far from practical, as it leads to very long comments.

I would like to either not receive these messages, or have them contain information on what happened (i.e., which branch was removed) in the repository. Now I receive a useless message saying that there are 0 changesets :-)
fields.summary: Commit notification emails for removed branches don't contain useful information (BB-7376)

fields.description:
I am following a repository, and on every page it looks the same, but on 'Commits' page it's showing me that I'm not following it. If I click to follow, I actually stop following it. It seems to be reproducible only for one repository from the team I'm in : https://bitbucket.org/camlab/mobias/commits/featurebranches .

I have attached the screenshots. The only difference is that I switch tabs.

For some reason Bitbucket thinks that I am the account "lobu" and not "lobu_tpr". I added a newly created public SSH key to my personal account. This account has write access to "lobuadmin". I cloned a repository to my machine using the SSH url and commited some test change and pushed it to the Bitbucket repository. The website tells that I am "lobu" not "Tobias Preuss" aka. "lobu_tpr".

To clarify: I had another! SSH key added to the "lobu" account before. But I removed this! Further "lobu" had write access to "lobuadmin" but this has been removed too!

Path:\\
Overview screen -> on the right, click on Branches (if you have more than 1) -> in the box that pops-up, hover the branch icon -> Message is incomplete.

The message says: "Show changes between  and the main branch".

Expected result: "Show changes between <branch hovered> and the main branch".
fields.summary: Minor issue in branches tooltips (overview screen)

fields.description: After attempt to strip revision from https://bitbucket.org/eugene_gff/ogre-patches repo it is now in 'This repository is currently being stripped. Please wait for a moment and then refresh this page or go to the repository overview.' state - for several months already. So this repository is unusable and could be deleted as a whole as I have local backup for it.

Markdown text may not only be written by hand but also autogenerated from html (For example erlang documentation tool Edoc generates documentation from srcs to html and then using module edown https://github.com/esl/edown generates Markdown for it.) Genetating tables by hand using -| syntax is not very easy and it would be nice if you will make this feature, which is highly usefull

I frequently want to create a bunch of issues at a time. When I create an issue, it takes me to the view issues screen but, if I want to create another issue, I have to go back to the issues summary page. Ideally I'd have the "create issue" button in the view issues screen so that I didn't have to keep going back to the issues summary page.

{{https://www.evernote.com/shard/s4/sh/2424c74f-1ae0-4436-99b7-3320fa1bf1e6/c420b97ac6ecafe12ff6be1efcab1281/deep/0/Screenshot%202/4/13%2010:17%20AM.jpg}}
fields.summary: Allow me to add issues from the view issues screen

fields.description:
When an expires immediately URL, is extracted, but fails and so is extracted the second time(try again), and the information for the new url is valid, Serviio caches the new information using the cache_Key from the ContentURLContainer produced by the initial extract, rather than the cacheKey produced by the second extract.

In the SkysportsPlus plugin, the cacheKey contains the playpath from the extracted url. As the following log shows, the second correct url was cached using the cacheKey containing the playpath from the initial url extract rather than that from the second url extract.

9:17:52,352 DEBUG [FeedItemUrlExtractor] skysportsplus: Starting extraction of url for item: ch9_8:30-Pittsburgh Penguins vs Washington Capitals\\
2013-02-03 09:17:52,353 DEBUG [FeedItemUrlExtractor] skysportsplus: Finished extraction of url: ContentURLContainer [fileType=VIDEO, contentUrl=rtmp://212.7.212.37:1935/live playpath=chchch756565 pageUrl=http://www.yycast.com/embed.php?fileid=chchch756565 swfUrl=http://cdn.yycast.com/player/player.swf live=1, thumbnailUrl=https://sites.google.com/site/serviiorss/ch9.png, expiresImmediately=true, cacheKey=SkysportsPlus_ch9_chchch756565, live=true, ]\\
...\\
2013-02-03 09:18:41,330 DEBUG [FeedUpdaterThread] Retrieving information about the video stream 'ch9_8:30-Pittsburgh Penguins vs Washington Capitals'\\
2013-02-03 09:19:00,344 DEBUG [FeedUpdaterThread] Cannot get information about the URL, it might have expired already. Trying again.\\
2013-02-03 09:19:00,344 DEBUG [FeedItemUrlExtractor] skysportsplus: Starting extraction of url for item: ch9*8:30-Pittsburgh Penguins vs Washington Capitals\\
2013-02-03 09:19:04,994 DEBUG [FeedItemUrlExtractor] skysportsplus: Finished extraction of url: ContentURLContainer [fileType=VIDEO, contentUrl=rtmp://62.212.72.193:1935/stream playpath=hhjkn?id=79220 swfurl=http://www.liveflash.tv/resources/scripts/eplayer.swf pageUrl=http://www.liveflash.tv live=1, thumbnailUrl=https://sites.google.com/site/serviiorss/ch9.png, expiresImmediately=true, cacheKey=SkysportsPlus_ch9_hhjkn?id=79220, live=true, ]\\
2013-02-03 09:19:29,489 DEBUG [TechnicalMetadataCacheDecorator] Stored technical metadata for online item 'SkysportsPlus_ch9_chchch756565' in the cache (online_technical_metadata), returning it
fields.summary: Wrong cachekey used on expires immediately second extract

fields.description:
Hi,

I am member in 3 teams. I commited data to one teams repository and instead of my username the dashboard shows the teamname of another team as the commiter.\\
I am member in this team too but thats the only connection between the two teams.

So this name should not appear in the commitlist.

Regards,\\
Markus

Quote:

When using bitbucket, I often am switching back/forth between repositories. Unfortunately since I have a lot of similarily named repositories and the width of the dropdown menu is not wide enough. I can't easily differentiate between the repositories. This wouldn't be an issue if I switched once/twice, but i switch repos a significant amount of times / day.

Would it be possible to either

{code}
Increase the width
Provide some way to give a "alias" for the repo name or repository owner name
{code}

[...] it would be nice if you could decide somehow what repositories are shown in the list. Ideally you could select 'favorite' repositories. I find it tough to work with since the repository list ordering changes each time.
fields.summary: Accommodate longer repository/account names in dropdown menu (BB-7415)

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to sort issues by the number of watchers. Bugs that many people are watching could then be prioritized to be fixed sooner.
fields.summary: Allow sorting of issues by popularity (BB-7393)

fields.description: I would feel more secure hosting our code on Bitbucket if I could set an option to have it require a code from Google Authenticator once a month the way that GMail and LastPass do.
fields.summary: Dual factor auth via Google Authenticator

fields.description: It is very simple to reproduce. Create a .html file. Link to some image inside of it. Add these to your hg repository. Link to the .html file from a Wiki page. The html will load, but the images and other resources can not be accessed because they are relatively referenced in the .html or hard coded and they don't have the token that bytebucket.org expects to be on the end. The documentation for the wiki says you can link to any file type. These same files work fine if referenced from some other web server or locally on the hard disk on the developer machine.
fields.summary: Unable to add a .html file to the wiki and link to images (BB-7437)

fields.description: When there is an private project with "Public issue tracker" and developers want to create bug-issue, which is critical and developers do not want the public to know about it, developers will create private issue. Or developer is working on feature, and he want to surprise the public, developer will create private issue.  Or developers are resolving internal issue, they will create private issue.
fields.summary: Add option to make specific issue private in "Public issue tracker" (BB-7414)

fields.description:
Hi,

Is it possible to format commit message to 'hide' signatures (or perhaps display it differently and going as far as notify user as the validity of the sig?).

Eg: https://bitbucket.org/rchavik/croogo/commits/6976e3b57f8fc10abbac44d0d0ab3f7a
fields.summary: GPG Signatures in git commit message

fields.description: I just logged in and then spent a few minutes staring at https://bitbucket.org/jamezpolley/ trying to figure out how to make a new repository. I ended up clicking on things at random, and was about to give up and got to github before I eventually found "Create Repository" under the "Repositories" dropdown
fields.summary: Hard to figure out how to create a repository

fields.description:
Hi,

For the new version of bitbucket UI, i seen a bug in the name of branch. To describ the bug i do a screenshot (because my englsih is worst).

I had created branch name "feature/videopage", with only tow commit. But lot of old commit have a tag "feature/videopage" in the tree commit page.

best regard,\\
Corentin Derbois

We currently have a user account *kaltireAdmin* which is used to administer a set of repositories for our client.

We have a second user accoung *flintAdmin* which is used to administer a second repository for a second client.

We have a third user account *middlewareAdmin* which is used to administer our own corporate repository (used for our own code + forked client repos).

There is no link between our two client accounts - as well to our corporate account!!!  They should not see anything about each other, nor should they see what I am observing.

Facts:

* my username is dmarley
* I should be able to push/pull changes ignorant to the client I am working on and see my bitbucket username show up beside my commits

I have attached some screen shots to demonstrate what I am observing

Log into kaltireAdmin account (kaltireAdminlogin.jpg)

Log into middlewareAdmin account (middlewareAdminLogin.jpg)

If I look at commits from (middlewareAdmin) back in Sept 2011 (when the kaltireAdmin account did not exist!!!) it is showing up as that user committed the code! (commit.jpg)

Can you provide me with an idea what is going on and what we need to do to fix?

Please inform.

Thanks,\\
Derek

derek@middleware360.com
fields.summary: User Linking and account commit issue (major issue)

fields.description:
SSH authentication is failing today:

FATAL ERROR: Disconnected: No supported authentication methods available (server sent: publickey)\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.

I definitely have access, I switched to HTTPS and everything worked fine (but by default I use SSH on all my repos).

I don't know if this is related to the SSH problems that were occurring on 31 January, but in that case it was intermittent failures, in this case it's all the time.

I created a public repo. Then in the downloads section, there are system defined downloads available(which are basically branch's latest commit in zip). I am unable to download those files, It says "Internal server error".

I believe this changed when support for Git was added: the generated URLs that reference changesets use the full 40 character hexadecimal node ID.

I understand that it's nice to provide the full IDs: that way you don't need to implement logic to handle collisions any better than the underlying tools, i.e., you don't need to handle them on the assumption that SHA-1 is a secure hash function.

However,

* The long links are cumbersome: instead of a handy short node ID (12 characters for Mercurial) that will fit into most search boxes without clipping, I'm giving a 40 character string. That string is way to big for me to handle as anything but an opaque blob of bytes.

With a short node ID I can glance at it in an email and quickly see if it looks like it's the same as the one shown in my browsers address bar. I can copy a small node ID by hand in full — with a long ID I need to decide when to give up and when my prefix is long enough. I can paste a short ID into most tools without it overflowing the input field. Overall short IDs are more convenient and handy.
* The long links are almost always longer than what I'm comfortable pasting into text. The fixed text ({{https://bitbucket.org/.../.../commits/}}) take up 30 characters, so with 40 characters for the node ID we're already at 70 and then you need to add the username and repository.

The result is a 80+ character link which flows very badly in a text file or an email. I end up with lines longer than 80 characters which means that my diffs display badly in a standard width terminal.
* The long links are mostly unnecessary. There are no collisions in the 275k changesets in the OpenOffice repository among the first 10 hexadecimal characters — there is a single collision among the first 9 characters.

This means that short links will work well in practice for almost all repositories.
* You should actually handle collisions anyway: today I can shorten the Bitbucket URLs and they still work:

** https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial-crew/commits/9fbeb61b8ad2
** https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial-crew/commits/9fbeb61b8
** https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial-crew/commits/9fbeb6

However, I get a "404 Not Found" if the prefix becomes ambiguous:

** https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial-crew/commits/9fb

That ought to be handled better: present the user with a list of matching changesets
fields.summary: Use short node IDs in your links (BB-7489)

fields.description: Is it possible to pass the Title and Description through the URL. Example: https://bitbucket.org/{user}/{repo}/issues/new/?title=xxx&desc=xxx

I have noticed that the following strings are sometimes missing the inverse ¿ at the beginning of the question which is grammatically incorrect in Spanish.

Can be made ahead? ¿Se puede hacer por adelantado?\\
Can be frozen? ¿Se puede congelar?\\
Good for leftovers ¿Se puede guardar para otro dia?

I think that the recipes that were created prior to my involvement with the project are the ones missing the ¿ mark. I don't know if there is an easy way to correct this that would not be too time consuming?

fields.summary: Fix tab size in source code viewer (BB-7488)
Branch name does not appear in Newsfeed or Recent Activity listing (BB-7392)

fields.description: As the issue title says.
fields.summary: Issue replies from email don't trigger email notifications (BB-7368)

fields.description:
The dashboard is so quiet, it seems like I'm alone here, a browse/explore/get social button would be nice.

I know how to search by owner/repo but is not so intuitive, and personally I feel it lacks flexibility, if you don't know the repo name you can't find it.

A global filter would be nice, last added, most watched.

Adding a button to create an issue from the issue display page would be handy when trying to add multiple issues. It would eliminate the need to go back to the issues list and click create from there.
fields.summary: Add "Create Issue" button to the issue display page (BB-7367)

fields.description:
Allow to choose which method to use when syncing feature branches: merge or rebase.

When using 'git rebase master' command in feature branch instead of 'git merge master', we'll get a linear history in feature branch, which is widely used in development, and considered a better way than lot of merging.

In navigation top bar, I often find that after I hover over my profile image and the sub menu opens as I move down and left to access an item I inadvertently enter the focus of the help menu and open that menu - not major but just annoying enough for me to write about it :).

Perhaps adding a slight delay before the new sub menu is open if another is active would resolve this.

Thanks for considering my thoughts.  - @danielsokolowski

My mail mask: str...str@mail.com

https://bitbucket.org/account/password/reset/ - http://storage5.static.itmages.ru/i/13/0201/h_1359732719_6468189_01dd81f5a7.png

But the registration was not a problem.

For example in this ticket:\\
https://bitbucket.org/acoustid/acoustid-server/issue/5/fingerprint-not-accepted-by-acoustid

The comments contain URLs like this: http://acoustid.org/track/f359aa4f-a480-4687-ae78-8bb2e9cdf894

But the code doing URL parsing splits it in two; the resulting link points to http://acoustid.org/track/f359aa4f-a480-4687-ae78- and the remaining 8bb2e9cdf894 is parsed as a commit hash.
fields.summary: URLs containing UUIDs are recognized incorrectly
